item.title: Report E-2024030173
item.description:
Report E-2024030173

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 29, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of Xylene (UN1307) was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. ISR personnel deployed granular absorbents to the xylene-impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. ISR personnel transferred the product from the damaged 275-gallon tote into a new one. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The trailer was loaded and at our Gary, In operating center in the shop when they observed it leaking from where the internal valve bolts up to the barrel. It appears that the internal valve gasket is leaking due to the bolts being loose or the gasket being old / deteriorated.

item.title: Report X-2024021923
item.description:
Report X-2024021923

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was damaged by a forklift. The fiberboard boxes were overpacked and shrink wrapped on 2 identical wooden pallets. The damaged box and 4 other boxes that were leaked on, were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper. Both pallets had 1 box that was damaged. Inner contents of each box were 4 plastic bottles. 1 inner bottle was damaged on pallet#1 Trk#775084501879. 2 plastic bottles were damaged in one box on pallet #5, Trk#775084502706. Total damage between the pallets is 15 Liters. The packages have been placed in salvage drums and held pending disposition from the shipper.
